alert.note: Alert for South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:28PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Pinal County through 415 PM MST... At 328 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Saddlebrooke, or 10 miles northwest of Catalina, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saddlebrooke, Kearny, Picacho Peak State Park, Cactus Forest and Oracle Junction. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 218 and 225. Route 77 between mile markers 89 and 93. Route 79 between mile markers 92 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle
